00004 /*! \file cvm-drv.h
00005     \brief  Core Driver: Initialization and instruction processing. 
00006  */
00007 
00008 
00009 #ifndef __CVM_DRV_H__
00010 #define __CVM_DRV_H__
00011 
00012 #include "cvm-driver-defs.h"
00013 
00014 #define RED_LOW_WMARK       (2 * 1024)
00015 #define RED_HIGH_WMARK      (3 * 1024)
00016 
00017 #if !defined(DISABLE_PCIE14425_ERRATAFIX)
00018 #define BP_CHECK_INTERVAL  1  /* Time in microseconds. */
00019 #define BP_LOW_WMARK       RED_LOW_WMARK
00020 #define BP_HIGH_WMARK      RED_HIGH_WMARK

00023 
00024 /** Core: The application should call this routine when its doing its per-core
00025   * local initialization. This routine sets up the scratchpad registers
00026   * used by the driver.
00027   */
00028 void
00029 cvm_drv_local_init(void);
00030 
00031 
00032 
00033 
00034 /** Core: The application should call this routine when it's doing global
00035   * initialization from only one of the cores its running on. This routines
00036   * sets up the PCI ports.
00037   *
00038   */
00039 int
00040 cvm_drv_init(void);
00041 
00042 
00043 
00044 
00045 
00046 /** Core: This routine sends a notification to the host driver is ready to
00047   * accept instructions. The application should call this from only one of
00048   * its cores.
00049   * 
00050   */
00051 int
00052 cvm_drv_start(void);
00053 
00054 
00055 
00056 
00057 
00058 /** Core: Common routine to parse all driver instructions. This routine looks
00059   * up the opcode to find a handler that's registered for this opcode.
00060   * If no handler is found, the wqe is freed. If a handler was found,
00061   * the handler is called with the WQE. The handler is expected to free
00062   * the WQE after its processing.
00063   *
00064   * @param  wqe - the work queue entry that contains the instruction.
00065   * @return  0 if a handler is found for the opcode; else 1.
00066   */
00067 int
00068 cvm_drv_process_instr(cvmx_wqe_t   *wqe);
00069 
00070 
00071 
00072 
00073 
00074 /** Core: Register a handler for an opcode. When the driver sees the opcode, it
00075  *  will call the function registered for the opcode.
00076  *  @param opcode - register this opcode.
00077  *  @param handler - register this function. Call it with the WQE pointer
00078  *                   when a raw instruction with the opcode above is received.
00079  *  @return 0 if the handler was registered successfully, else 1.
00080  */
00081 int
00082 cvm_drv_register_op_handler(uint16_t   opcode, int (*handler)(cvmx_wqe_t *));
00083 
00084 
00085 
00086 
00087 /** Core: Sets the application type. The application type registered by this call
00088  *  is passed to the host when the core driver sends the start notification
00089  *  in cvm_drv_start().  Application types are defined in
00090  *  driver/common/octeon-drv-opcodes.h
00091  *  @param app_mode: application type.
00092  */
00093 void
00094 cvm_drv_setup_app_mode(int app_mode);
